subject: Management
title: Peer Feedback Loops
description: A fast breakdown of Peer Feedback Loops for builders.

hook.text: A design team started weekly peer critiques. Design quality improved more in two months than in the prior year.

buildup.text: Manager feedback is limited. Peers see different things: collaboration, daily habits, real skill.

discovery.text: Peer feedback loops create shared accountability and faster learning across the team.

twist.text: Peers often sugarcoat to stay friends. Structure the process so honesty feels safe and expected.

climax.text: Create structured peer review sessions. Use prompts. Normalize directness. Make it a team ritual.

punchline.text: Your peers see what your boss misses. Ask them.

quiz.question: Why is peer feedback valuable beyond manager feedback?
options: Peers observe daily collaboration and skills that managers often miss
Peer feedback is always more honest than manager feedback
Peers should replace managers as the sole source of all feedback
